titles.title: National Guard Bureau Act of 1994
To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide a charter for the National Guard Bureau, otherwise to improve the administration of the National Guard, and for other purposes.

bill.summary: 3/24/1994--Introduced. National Guard Bureau Act of 1994 - Establishes in the Department of Defense (DOD) the National Guard Bureau as a joint bureau of the Departments of the Army and Air Force. Makes the Bureau the supervisory and operating agency of DOD for the Army and Air National Guard. Provides for the appointment in the Bureau of a Chief and Vice Chief. Considers an assignment to the Bureau a joint duty assignment. Provides the authorized strengths of reserve general and flag officers serving on active duty in the Bureau, the Office of a Chief of a reserve component, or the headquarters of a reserve component command.
